Description: Painted blue glazed composition shabti of a Lady of the House with a black lappet-wig, a modelled face with traced eyes, a black collar and crossed hands in relief with black bracelets holding two black hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a representation of a seed-basket and a yoke with two pendular nw-pots; the lower leg section has broken away.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
